intro: Corispermum calvum, commonly known as the smooth corisperm, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is a small, annual herb that typically grows in arid or saline environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. The plant has simple, linear leaves and produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its seeds are enclosed in dry, capsule-like fruits, a characteristic feature of the Chenopodiaceae family. Corispermum calvum is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
